intro: Senna meridionalis, commonly known as the golden senna, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant is characterized by its bipinnate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It produces long, slender pods containing numerous seeds. Senna meridionalis is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of natural dyes.
